website_summaries.verdict: The MeMO Pad is an outstanding big-screen, low-budget tablet. The 10.1-inch FHD screen is vibrant, and the entire thing is only 1.3 pounds. It’s not the fastest kid on the block, but it’s more than competent, and it’s incredibly affordable.
pros: It’s thin, light, and has a beautiful screen
Battery life is respectable, and it’s great for streaming video and traveling
cons: It supports 802.11b/g/n WiFi networks but not 802.11ac WiFi
The blue exterior shell isn’t everyone’s favorite color

customer_reviews.title: Power button broke twice - correction, three times
customer_reviews.text: update: power button broke a third time I'M DONE It's a great form factor, nice screen, decent sound. All good. I appreciate the micro usb charger, as I have two boxes full of mystery power cables and don't need any more. We're probably in the market for a keyboard, but haven't really needed it that much. update: power button broke twice and I'm tired of dealing with it. When it works, it is awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very nice tablet.  But after 5 years the touch screen stopped working.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this on Feb. 2014. Five years later, the touch screen stopped working. Too bad ASUS never really sent Android updates. Stuck on JellyBean 4.2.2. A lot of Apps are no longer compatible. XDA-Dev website never created custom ROM for this tablet. Probably because it's an Intel processor instead of ARM. Pros: Clear, crisp display. Really good sound. Long battery life. HDMI port was really useful being able to connect to a flat screen TV. I'll never buy another ASUS product. (Had an ASUS EeePC netbook and that also died!)
customer_reviews.author: coolnezz

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy if you want a device that has been kept up to date.
customer_reviews.text: When I bought this in 2015 I thought I was getting a great little tablet. It does many of the things I want in a tablet and has 2gb of RAM and 1920x1200 resolution. The problem is that ASUS is no longer updating this item. It is still on Android version 4.4.2 from 2014. It looks like ASUS only supported this item for a few months before moving on and leaving all its purchasers in the dust. ASUS makes good products but this is not one.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher M Talley

customer_reviews.title: Great first time or replacement tablet
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this to replace my 2 year old Motorola Xoom. I was looking for a model similar in specs and was pleasantly surprised with this model. I do presentations and wanted HDMI output, not found on many tablets. HDMI Out works flawlessly and allows you to keep continuous charge supplied to the Tablet while viewing the Tablet on your tv. After receiving the tablet, I had a couple questions and contacted ASUS support, spoke to a live rep who answered my questions - tremendous! It also has a microSD card slot so you can add additional storage to your tablet ... something most alternative Android tablets don't have. I would recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bought mine in 2-2017 and worked for a year. ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought mine in 2-2017 and worked for a year. I had to do a factory restart on it two different times. The power button quite working in April of 2018. Can not turn off or on. Wish I had read the older reviews back in 2015. Also while in use would only hold a charge for 3 hours and after a hour of use would get hot on back. Also had to take it out of protective case I had bought or would freeze up.
customer_reviews.author: christina hunt

customer_reviews.title: Very good product. (Updated)
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my mom. She likes it a lot. These are a few things she notices since started using this: Pros: _ Long battery life. _ New android version are easy to use.. _ Fast internet surfing, _ Plays HD video smoothly Cons: _ A few bloat-ware but can easily be disable. _ T̶h̶e̶ ̶f̶r̶o̶n̶t̶ ̶c̶a̶m̶e̶r̶a̶ ̶w̶o̶n̶'̶t̶ ̶w̶o̶r̶k̶ ̶w̶h̶e̶n̶ ̶i̶ ̶u̶s̶e̶ ̶o̶o̶V̶o̶o̶ ̶a̶n̶d̶ ̶s̶o̶m̶e̶ ̶o̶t̶h̶e̶r̶ ̶v̶i̶d̶e̶o̶ ̶c̶a̶l̶l̶i̶n̶g̶ ̶s̶o̶f̶t̶w̶a̶r̶e̶s̶.̶ ̶(̶T̶a̶k̶i̶n̶g̶ ̶p̶i̶c̶t̶u̶r̶e̶s̶ ̶a̶n̶d̶ ̶r̶e̶c̶o̶r̶d̶i̶n̶g̶ ̶v̶i̶d̶e̶o̶s̶ ̶a̶r̶e̶ ̶o̶k̶)̶.̶ Update May 25, 2014: After a firmware update from ASUS this morning, the front camera now works perfectly with every video calling app i use. And i'm confident to give it 5 stars. Good work ASUS!
customer_reviews.author: Vincent

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value for your tablet dollar!
customer_reviews.text: This tablet gives any competitor a run for their money. With a large clear screen, excellent resolution, two cameras, and, most importantly, the ability to add on a microSD card, this is a very serious competitor to all the big names out there. The price is very agreeable. This is truly a powerhouse tablet, and the installed Android version is by far the best I have used so far. I seriously see no good reason to pay any more money for those other pretentious tablets that do not even allow to add on external memory. This tablet works very well for everything, from email to movies to internet search. No complaints whatsoever.
customer_reviews.author: GB

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: I have been using mine almost daily for nearly 6 months now: The full HD screen is great for watching movies and playing games. The processor is fast enough for any apps I've tried. Battery time is OK, but not great, some apps seems to eat a lot more than others. I have not used the camera much, but the few pictures i have taken look just fine. It is slightly on the heavy side. The price is great. It cost much less than Samsung Galaxy tab 3, which only has 1200x800 screen. Value for price it is a clear 5-star product. Update after another six months, it still is working fine, and no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: BooksMusicGadgets

customer_reviews.title: Everything i need
customer_reviews.text: I've had this tablet for several months now and it does everything I need. admittedly what I need is fairly basic like watching some YouTube videos email web surfing etc. the display is very clear and the colors seem quite vibrant. it receives my wifi signal better than my iPad 1 did when at some distance from the transmitter. for basic user like myself this product seems to do almost everything that items priced at double and triple this price do. the voice recognition software is also excellent, I wrote this entire review just by speaking it into the device and had to make zero corrections. So far so good I am a satisfied purchaser.
customer_reviews.author: C. ROMANOFSKY

customer_reviews.title: Just perfect for me
customer_reviews.text: I am using my MeMo pad FHD to read books & news, watch videos and movies & generally "surf" the internet. The ASUS is doing that very well and showing me how fast XFINITY really is.Have 16 GB + 32 GB micro SD and feel the unit is fit for all my needs. Notably better performing in all aspects than my $ 200 more expensive ASUS Transformer that I bought 3 Years ago (and that is giving problems now). So, this is probably the best budget tablet and I prefer it over my wife's I PAD (II). Only down: The sluggish reacting "on" switch needs getting used too. Anyway: Highly recommended for price tag @ US$ 250 or less.
customer_reviews.author: RPB - Houston/TX

customer_reviews.title: Great Pad at a supper price!!!
customer_reviews.text: This Asus pad is a wonderful buy and has all the features of the more expensive products out there. Why pay more when the Asus can fit the bill and has good ratings by websites like "cnet.com." So do your homework like we did and buy the best product you need and don't leave any "money on the table" unless you have more than you need. Send some of the money you save to a charity that needs the money much more. A+ product that is easy and convenient to use. We recommend it for yourself or as a gift for someone.
customer_reviews.author: JEA

customer_reviews.title: Great Tablet
customer_reviews.text: Have been waiting awhile before buying a tablet. Had been leaning toward the ASUS 700, but there were a lot of negative comments, and saw that an upgrade was coming with the ASUS 701. However this new tablet had worse reviews than the 700. Then I came across the ASUS MeMo Pad ME302C, and saw that it got the best reviews of all the ASUS tablets. It has almost all the benefits of the 700, but also includes 2GB of memory, and at a much better price. Have found it to be very easy to set up, battery life is great, and the display is fantastic. I think this will be a strong competitor to any of the Apple tablets
customer_reviews.author: RACN33

customer_reviews.title: nice friendly tablet
customer_reviews.text: I recommend it instead iPad1/2/3/4. * full house of free apps in amazon apps store and google apps store. * you able to upgrade it's memory up to 64gb(use micro SD slot), unfortunately I don't have micro SD 128Gb, I can't say if it'll support. but you can have as many as you want micro SD lower volume, use them as tapes from old VHS. * you able to use up to 1tb external HDD or usb flash drives (use OTG adapter) without any software. * you don't need convert media files to readable format, as you have to do this for Apple trash. * long life battery. * clear picture.
customer_reviews.author: Garg

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic tablet
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for my 27 year old daughter (so that I could have my Galaxy Tab back - she's been borrowing it - LOL). She'd been wanting her own for quite a while, so this was her Christmas present this year. After giving it a full 8 hour charge before using, she used it for another 8 hours and reported back to me the next day with the following quote: "THANKS DAD!! My new tablet kicks your tablet's BUTT!!!" That's exactly what I was hoping for when I bought it for her. She's very happy, so I'm very happy. :)
customer_reviews.author: Buck R. Cash

customer_reviews.title: Two Weeks And Doin' Great!
customer_reviews.text: So far so good! There's been no down side to this tablet as of yet (I say this due to others complaining of loss due to multiple issues). I have received and experienced all the good, to this point, and wil come back in 6 months to update my experience(s)! The screen is wonderful, the sound great, speed/response time above expectation, I've loaded a significant amount of apps with no problems - I don't do games so I don't know if it is at all good with same(?). I'm using this for business and so far is living up to my expectations for work.
customer_reviews.author: Damaso A. Joa

customer_reviews.title: Good ratio of HD resolution/price, but big trouble after updating to Android 4.3
customer_reviews.text: I found this seemed to be the best value tablet in terms of specs (with HD resolution and 2 GB memory) to price. It worked great for several days until I loaded up a few updates that brought it from Android 4.2.2 to 4.3. Then, the network speed slowed down to a crawl often, with no explanation - other devices on the network had no such issue with even weaker wifi signals. It also appeared to have bluetooth issues, especially with an LG bluetooth headset (random disconnects and noise). Again, the same headset works fine on my phone and other tablets. Even at only $200, I couldn't live with the issues, and back it went for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: TG

customer_reviews.title: Excellent but... / Don't buy ASUS products. Its warranty is useless!
customer_reviews.text: It is very good except one minor problem: It attracts fingerprints. My other tablets, a Nexus 7 (also Asus) which died suddenly, and an iPad do not attract as much fingerprints and are much easier to clean. Maybe Asus uses a cheaper screen on this model? ================================== Updated 10/7/16 Downgraded from 1 stars to 1 star. ASUS's warranty it useless! I have an ASUS charger malfunctioning under warranty. They kept asking basic information like serial number, etc. Gave them 3 times. Still keeps asking the same questions without solving the problem. Never trust this company again!
customer_reviews.author: nusaco888Top Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Loved the tablet
customer_reviews.text: Found the tablet to be a little less than I wanted, but gave 2 of them to my sons and they are overjoyed. Pluses: the big one was the battery life. It really lived up to mfg claims. Good viewing experience and easy and quick to learn. Download nearly instant. Liked the price too. Bought an iPad air to replace one I gave to second son. Battery life shorter. But operates and charges exactly like my iPhone. Very fast. Takes a little longer to charge battery. Did find that scrabble would not download to Asus, which is a big deal to me because I like to play online.
customer_reviews.author: Char Hirschi

customer_reviews.title: Nice Pad and does what we want!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to get my wife a pad for surfing the net, pintrest, facebook, e-mail etc... This tablet is perfect, thin, light and a large super sharp screen. Very pleased with the cameras too, both front and back. Rear camera takes great shots or video. Negative of a tablet is printing to our wireless printer doesn't happen without another program? But that is a negative to the andriod and Ipad software I understand. That's the only negative I can find so far, I'd buy this again! For the money its a great value
customer_reviews.author: Tom from Virginia

customer_reviews.title: Started off good
customer_reviews.text: But then it decided to quit charging - I would leave it plugged in for 8 hours while I was at work and the battery might gain 10%. I was just finally allowed to put in an RMA after the third try talking to their "Technical Support" who recommended a factory reset and an unauthorized, underpowered charger. To add a cherry on top of this steaming crap sundae, after blowing a few hours dealing with their tech support, they dont even provide the courtesy of providing a prepaid shipping label which has been pretty standard practice for the last decade. Asus it seems is no longer the great hardware company that they used to be
customer_reviews.author: Emersojo

customer_reviews.title: Virtual keyboard not working sometimes...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after reading the positive reviews. The tablet overall works fine with an occasional slow response to your finger tapping. I don't tab that quick, just at the speed of about one tab per second. The one thing that bothers me the most is that the virtual keyboard would not display when I tab on a text field to type in any app. The screen would show the modal window as if the keyboard was to be displayed, but it does not. It requires a system restart to resolve the issue. So far, this has occurred about 3 times in 3 months. Maybe it requires some system update. I'll contact support and see if they have a solution.
customer_reviews.author: Henry

customer_reviews.title: We're thrilled with it
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my son, who's just starting high school. He's really thrilled with it. We added a Bluetooth keyboard, and he's been doing his writing assignments with it, and saving them to cloud storage. I just didn't see any reason to get him a $450+ notebook when a $240 tablet would do the job. The 1920 x 1200 display is great, it's quick & responsive, and the 16 GB internal storage is more than adequate; adding up to 32 GB with a microSD card sealed the deal. It also has HDMI output, so he can show photos & videos on a much bigger screen. This is one purchase that my son & I have both been very pleased with.
customer_reviews.author: DanoB

customer_reviews.title: great tablet with fhd display and battery life
customer_reviews.text: High resolution display, good wifi sensitivity, fast response cpu takes on every app, easy on the budget and easy on the eyes. 7 inch is great for some things but for reading publications, 10 is needed for magazines and books. With external sdcard and otg flashdrive, more content such as videos are offloaded and easier to swap. Battery life is great. Kids drain my phone dry twice a day but this tablet keeps them busy and saves my phone for my calls and messages. 7 inch tablets lasts a couple of hours so a pair of them in the car run out of battery fast but this 10 inch tablet keeps them busy all day and night.
customer_reviews.author: Dragonspeak

customer_reviews.title: Stop worrying, this is really good
customer_reviews.text: This is my 5th Android device and wow is this device good. I usually root a device on the first day...it's been a couple of months and I still have the stock image, not rooted...it's that good. The processor is crazy fast, RAM hasn't maxed out yet even though I have 30-40 apps running sometimes, and the USB, extra memory card space, and HDMI output is just icing on the cake (though these are typical Android device features). I am very pleased with the device and take it to meetings as well as the couch.
customer_reviews.author: KELLY

customer_reviews.title: Great Tablet
customer_reviews.text: I researched tablets for a few weeks before deciding on an Android OS and then on this one. Samsung Galaxy Tab and Note seemed to be the big name challengers. I ultimately chose this over the Samsungs because of the HD screen definition. It has a beautiful picture for watching movies on Netflix or from my cloud. All of the Android apps work and look good as well. I didn't buy it for the camera. I tried it to make sure it worked, and it takes decent photos but I have seen better. I would recommend this to others.
customer_reviews.author: Marnie Hecknauer

customer_reviews.title: Wife Happy
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my wife to download books and to surf the internet. After initially becoming a little anxious learning to use a new computer variant, she absolutely loves this tablet. It is similar to using her Razr Android and that helped in quickly learning the Asus Memo Pad. I purchased a 32 gig high speed micro sd card from Amazon. She now has over 10k books in her hand, and that took up only a fifth of the micro sd card! That fact in itself is phenomenal. She also loves the available apps and it has a long battery life. This tablet is certainly a BEST BUY.
customer_reviews.author: Wallace A. Chambers

customer_reviews.title: Great tablet for those that know what they are buying.
customer_reviews.text: The resolution of this tablet is awesome and unmatched for it's price range. It's not a super fast latest 3d gamer, but otherwise is very powerful. The x86 cpu has some draw backs as not every app under the sun works, but every app I use except for flash player runs fine. I can't watch Amazon Prime, but frankly the prime experience on a tablet or computer sucks anyway. I watch my own digital library of high quality HD movies on it all the time. This is a great tablet for the price if you understand it isn't a typicsl ARM baseb tablet.
customer_reviews.author: David Eric Hibshman

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good for basic use
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my 85 year old Aunt. She play very simple games on it and it works fine. It is a struggle to fo anything on the internet. A little slow in my book.
customer_reviews.author: A. Tucker

customer_reviews.title: WARNING AVOID ASUS
customer_reviews.text: ASUS - WARNING! Never buy an ASUS product. They do not update Android systems on their tablets and customer support will not tell you where to download a newer version so you can do it manually. Also their support people are from some foreign country with a bad connection and an accent that is hard to understand. AVOID ASUS!! They continue to sell the MeMO Pad ME302C with Android 4.2 in 2017 and refuse to update. Many apps will no longer run on 4.2.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: cheap and powerful
customer_reviews.text: I gave it 5 stars because although this is a cheap tablet, it has the potential to run games and apps smoothly. If you don‘t want to spend your money in an expensive device, this one is the most suitable for you. Asus Memo Pad FHD 10 teaches you that is not necessary to have an (overrated) iPad or Galaxy tablet to have real fun and quality. However, this one has a minor bug when it comes to the blocking screen. Sometimes when you want to unlock the tablet the touchscreen doesn‘t respond properly, but after a couple of attempts the touchscreen gets responsive again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: best bang for your buck
customer_reviews.text: it arrived in a box that was not damaged, the product seemed to packaged well. and the tablets box was also in very good shape. for the tablet it came in a plastic cover when removed from the box unlike similar tablets that comes with the clear removable screen vinyl. once out of the cover it came precharged at around 30%. the quality is very good and has excellent streaming video playback also with good sound. the camera does autofocus as well as take exceptional pictures and recordings. overall i would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Mad_metal

customer_reviews.title: Not the best choice for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Okay performance, but right after warranty expired, it started having battery issues. Battery expands when charged and starts to cause interference with power switch. If you use tablet while it lies flat on a table it works with no problems, but if you hold in hand, it will power down every time you touch the corner of the screen. A tablet that you cannot hold is pretty useless. Lots of reviews on Android forums about Asus tablets with the same issue, to bad I did not read them before I got this one. Asus Tech support very difficult to deal with. Sorry I made this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: NC

customer_reviews.title: Nice tablet, here's the link to the owner's manual
customer_reviews.text: Just got this tablet for web browsing and light email. Fantastic display, fast browsing. Like that it takes a memory card. Might be a good choice for a computer novice or an older person--very simple to use. I wanted to know more about the tablet and was going crazy looking for the owner's manual--if it's pre-loaded on the device, I can't find it. (If you know where, let me know!) But here it is online:  Price on this thing varies widely, it pays to shop around and look for deals.
customer_reviews.author: HikerMom

customer_reviews.title: Very nice!
customer_reviews.text: The HD, sound, speed, touch sensitivity, and price are outstanding. I highly recommend this device if you are upgrading from an older pad and do not wish to pay an outlandish price for the premium devices, whether it be Android or iOS! I have had a Nexus 7 and a HP TouchPad and this device blows them both out of the water. My wife has an older iPad so I cannot compare the graphics to the newer models but you will not be disappointed with the screen resolution and HD of this Asus.
customer_reviews.author: TR

customer_reviews.title: Bad power switch
customer_reviews.text: Expensive product with a cheap power switch. Switch started failing after a few months of light use. Found a You Tube video about the issue and how to somewhat fix the problem . Have not used it much since, so basically was a waste of money. Thought ASUS was better than this.
customer_reviews.author: P Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Everything I wanted and more!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love love love.my tablet. I've been researching tablet's for months waiting for the right time to buy at the right price. Trying to find the right tablet with everything I wanted seemed to be endless. Its got it all for me. Dual cameras, HDMI, USB, and micro SD card ports which was my main reason for the purchase. It's HD quality is phenomenal, the Flash plugin works amazingly with online TV shows, great 16gb space for all my stuff, but most importantly the 10 inch screen with its amazing resolution. All for a great steal!!!!! I'm definitely satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: PnkstrLuvsPnk

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Tablet !!!!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent budget priced alternative to both the Ipad and Samsung products. Loaded with features and useful apps. No issues adding my music and books and transferring them between it and my laptop was a breeze. Video quality blew me away, though the default video settings had to be altered to suit my taste, this was easy to accomplish. Sound can be optimized for music, games or voice. No issues with gameplay and touch response was good. I appreciate being able to move files so easily and the micro SD card reader means virtually limitless storage capacity (just swap cards). Front cam works great with impressive video, rear is quite suitable for video chat.
customer_reviews.author: Arthur

customer_reviews.title: Great machine!
customer_reviews.text: This pad does everything I need from a pad. Long battery life, sharp display, lightweight design, and a snappy interface make this pad a perfect choice. It runs native Android apps you can download from Google Play. I was seriously thinking of getting an Amazon Fire HDX but the non-standard Android OS and inability to download apps from Google Play was a killer for that otherwise slick pad. The price of this Asus was also a plus.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas D. Farren

customer_reviews.title: Great tablet for a non-high tech old guy.
customer_reviews.text: My wife loves Apple products- Mac, iphone, iPad. She wanted to give me an iPad for Christmas. I did some research and discovered that even though this tablet might not be quite as sexy as an iPad, it would do what I needed at a much lower cost. I have added some apps and use the tablet mainly to read and compose email and search the web. It takes decent pictures and is pretty easy to set up and use. A good value for a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Frierson Craig

customer_reviews.title: So far so good, and the price is right for what you get.
customer_reviews.text: I only just purchased this as a gift for someone who is NOT computer savvy. She hasn't had it long enough to really have an opinion beyond the fact that so far it delivers as promised. It is basically like using a large Android smart phone, with Google support and sign-in. It has way more apps than the recipient will ever use, but so far she is happy with it. Screen is bright, sound is good, battery seems to last fairly long. The price is definitely right when you compare to an ipad.
customer_reviews.author: Sara Bellum

customer_reviews.title: ASUS MeMO Pad FHD 10
customer_reviews.text: I have loved this from the moment I purchased it. At first I was a little disappointed because Adobe Flash player doesn't work on this but I knew that before purchasing it and I couldn't find a tablet that it did work on. But since that time Google play has had apps for me to download that has allowed me to play the things I love and watch show I love with out having to have the flash player so I am a happy camper. The price is awesome for what you get. I had done a lot of research before purchasing and I am very happy with the product.
customer_reviews.author: glorybee1960

customer_reviews.title: Best tablet with less price for 2 years and Dead now
customer_reviews.text: I love this tablet when i first opened it . good price with big size and if it had cellular connection with another 50$ extra i would have brought it ,but it is 300$ plus and i settled for this tablet. i will update the second review after some usage around 1 month or 2 . Update 1/16/2018 - Its been year of use and the Tablet is dead . None of the App is updating and Playstore stop working . i tried all option to update it and recover it ,but no luck . Hope to move to Apple or samsung with high price range . Lesson learned.
customer_reviews.author: user

customer_reviews.title: Touch screen issues "ghost" touch. Sent in 2 times ...
customer_reviews.text: Touch screen issues "ghost" touch. Sent in 2 times for repair, same issue. After reading so many same experiences on line, I found the fix. Took it apart my self and wrapped plastic wrap around the digitizer ribbon cable and corrected the problem. Major flaw in design.
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: Wow!
customer_reviews.text: I had purchased a VERY cheap tablet, specifically in an effort to ascertain whether I really needed such a device. Although the el-cheapo product I initially purchased broke in a matter of weeks, I bit the bullet and bought this ASUS Memo Pad FHD 10, and I have not looked back. It stays charged for days (well, DAY - even THAT'S good!), runs apps efficiently, and is well-built. Spend the extra and get a nice product. You'll not be sorry. I'm now an ASUS fan.
customer_reviews.author: popmidi

customer_reviews.title: asus memo pad fhd10
customer_reviews.text: I have not had good luck with mine so far as downloading certain apps like skype are getting stuck at 13% of the download and then I get some weird message. I do like the convenience of easily just swiping the tablet to turn on and get emails and do research. Unfortunately now my tablet starting playing the startup loop that you get when you first open your tablet for the first time, and I think it will require a reset. Hopefully that will solve my download problems.
customer_reviews.author: David Farberow

customer_reviews.title: They are not good products. They have screen problems
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of them on December 22, 2013 from Amazon. However, They are not good products. They have screen problems. Their screen disappear suddenly when playing simple games. Also its materials are not durable and they are made of simple plastic and therefore it is too convenient to be broken. I don't recommend this product. Instead of it, you buy a Samsung or apple products by paying a little much more.
customer_reviews.author: Suleyman Demir

customer_reviews.title: a bit lighter and much better resolution. In fact
customer_reviews.text: I bought this tablet as a replacement for an aging Toshiba Thrive. It's quick, a bit lighter and much better resolution. In fact, now I can see what poor quality many of the posted videos on Facebook are. Web browsing is fast and Netflix is smooth and looks good. I charged the tablet for the recommended 8 hours before playing with it and the battery lasted all day.
customer_reviews.author: Rallyx38

customer_reviews.title: A great buy!
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift to my mom. It was a great value for the money. It is user friendly and provided a good introduction for a first time tablet user. Furthermore, it appearance is elegant a bit of an eye catcher in fact. Best of all its light weight makes it easy for her to use it as an e-reader when attending religious service as opposed to the Bible and other publications need for these meetings which are quiet heavy. In sum it a great tablet for serious study/reading, play and browsing.
customer_reviews.author: Dee David

customer_reviews.title: Not Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: I have had this tablet for about 5 months now. The screen is beautiful and it feels good when holding it. Unfortunately, as much as i want to love this tablet, it has major issues that cannot be forgiven. The screen frequently glitches out by becoming unresponsive and clicking randomly all over the place. Also, apps such as HBO GO do not buffer and properly show videos (App works on other tablets). I wish the software performed and worked because everything else is spot on for the price paid.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel E. Beil

customer_reviews.title: It does everything I needed it to.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased one of these for myself about a month or so ago and I liked it enough that I purchased another for my wife's birthday. I hope she enjoys hers it as much as I enjoy mine. I hope it plays the games she likes to play on her daughters android tablet. I am not sure since this has an intel prosesser. I don't understand all that stuff. That being said I think it has a great display, a responsive touchscreen, and good battery life.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Hoffman

customer_reviews.title: memo pad
customer_reviews.text: Im happy with it. Im using it to write this review. It seems to be relaible I have been using it foor about two months. It does freeze up now and then but not biggie I just hold the power button shut down and reboot...all is well after that. Battery last a day or at best 4-5 hours constant use. It does what i want it to do, surf the web, email and buy stuff. I play a few games and they seem to work good. I would recommend the MeMo pad.
customer_reviews.author: Aav

customer_reviews.title: Works awesome! I love it!
customer_reviews.text: I had two kindlefire and this was a huge upgrade. I can run many apps without "freezing" and the battery noticeably lasts longer. When you first get it make sure to charge it fully while it is shut down. Then it charges faster and only charge when battery notifies. I love it! Asus, I will buy again for sure! Also, the company who sells it (Adorama Camera) is very accommodating and responds in a timely manner to all customer concerns and queries.
customer_reviews.author: Jeva G.

customer_reviews.title: Value for Money
customer_reviews.text: This is certainly a serious contender. Pros: 1. Not very expensive 2. Works smooth 3. GPS receiver picks up signal from indoors as well. 4. It is Android based... :) 5. HDMI output and 2GB RAM Cons: 1. I expected XBMC to work on this device, looks like XBMC app is not optimized for Intel processor. This is not device issue, it is app issue. But, just wanted to mention it. Edited on 22 August 2014. FINALLY, XBMC has an x86 version for Android devices. I am able to use XBMC without any issues.
customer_reviews.author: gsiruvani

customer_reviews.title: Still works wonderfully after one year with no problems
customer_reviews.text: Still works wonderfully after one year with no problems.....It is quick and easy to read my books on.....Then switch to CNBC to watch a video about the day's news or go to Amazon, Walmart, Macys or any store to make a purchase....Read my email.....It does everything it is suppose too.....Would order it again if needed.....
customer_reviews.author: gmagamer

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Great tablet for the price. I don't see it getting software updates to often, not going to see latest and greatest Android here. Battery life isn't that great I mainly use for YouTube, movies, and some reading. At half the price of whatever Nexus Tablet that's out cant really complain. It has sd slot and you can also use OTG which allows you hook up a mouse, keyboard or a terabyte hard drive
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: A Good Work Tool
customer_reviews.text: This is a really solid tablet that gets the job done at a good price. The screen is amazing for reading and watching video, and it switches from app to app in a flash. My only beef is that it's still not running Kit Kat and the response time can be slow every now and then. I definitely find it to be more flexible and and far more useful as a work tool than my iPad, and it's way cheaper to crank up the storage.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's an okay product really
customer_reviews.text: Laggy, Sluggish sometimes. It is an okay product. I like (Pros+) the screen, speakers, mic, back, Battery life, Splendid, converter (Cons-) no need for the scenes as it really cause it to lag.... also no RAM manager. Can't tell how much RAM in there Takes a lot of time to load PDF pages on its mybook reader. Can't handle games like Iron Man. Good for social apps, reading, browsing... so It is okay
customer_reviews.author: Al Akshar M.D

customer_reviews.title: Alot better than last tablet i had that i had to return..
customer_reviews.text: This tablet runs great. Its fast to download apps and graphics are awesome. Its alot better than the Dragon Touch in my opinion. I had that and its a good tablet I just wasnt fond of the resolution it had. This one is pretty good on that. If you are looking for good sound, resolution, fast, and good memory than this would be great for you or whoever else. Im loving it. It is nice to hold and color blue is nice color for this tablet. Im still playing around with it and using it right now for this review. Im really glad i got it. I recommend this tablet :)
customer_reviews.author: Erica Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Pretty much satisfied.
customer_reviews.text: Very satisfied so far. There are some issues with waking it up at times but they don't occur too often. Its light and thin. With the use of an SD card it has more than enough storage for my purposes. And its every but as fast as my 2013 Nexus 7, I'll see if it slows down as I add apps to it. Screen is excellent and bright. Can't beat it for price to performance. I've only had it about a week now so I'll see.
customer_reviews.author: Al C. B

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this tablet!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect and couldn't fit my needs any better! I can do email, Facebook, Angry Birds (lol), Amazon Prime (with Puffin Web Browser, free and Adobe Flash) and of course Kindle. There are tons of apps and games to pick from for free. No hang ups, no crashing, the camera is decent and works well. It's pretty user friendly and doesn't take much to set it up. For the money, it's a great deal!!
customer_reviews.author: KindleCustomer

customer_reviews.title: Best Tablet ever !!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the best tablet I have ever owned. I use it all the time and take it with me whenever I go anywhere. I decided to go with the Asus tablet because, Asus is already a leader in computer hardware components and their name is recognized worldwide as high quality. The price for what you get is amazing. The picture quality is second to none. I am truly happy that I decided to go with Asus, a great decision on my part.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Duffy

customer_reviews.title: Impressed
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my wife and she loves it. Still learning all the features but for the price you can't beat it. I checked it out on You Tube and virtually every review was positive. They of course compare it to the IPad which isn't fair but you might be surprised by what was said. I have a Nexus 7 which I swear by but am looking for a larger tablet and I am leaning towards this one.
customer_reviews.author: Brett

customer_reviews.title: Like it so far.
customer_reviews.text: So far the only thing I think needs improving with this tablet is the processor speed. It's not as fast or as powerful as some others out there and it really shows if you're trying to do something like access a web page with a lot of ad content. Doesn't really bother me and it performs fine for what I use it for. If processing speed is a big thing for you though you should probably look at a different tablet.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher B.

customer_reviews.title: Very nice product
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves the ease of using this item, wish it had come with some written istructions, but he's managing, my husband is not a computer savey person, he's new to the electric world.
customer_reviews.author: Leanna

customer_reviews.title: Really great tablet. Great clarity and sound
customer_reviews.text: Really great tablet. Great clarity and sound... I would buy another one because my son dropped it and damaged the screen. Only downfall is that I thought it came with a casing. The external packaging was poor but the tablet was well protected on the inside.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Amazing tablet.. 10/10
customer_reviews.text: This is the best tablet out there for the price. Beautiful, smooth and runs cool all the time. -Powerful CPU, everything runs fast and smooth -Screen is beautiful, crisp -Battery life is great, 100% to 72% after like 2h and a half of use..(Netflix, browsing, gaming with 60-70% brightness) -Touch is very smooth and accurate, no lag/stutter -Speakers are amazing, loud and clear (best I've heard on a tablet) -Camera is good ( I don't use camera on tablet though) -Light, thin and easy to hold -White texture on the back looks beautiful I honestly don't have any dislikes about this tablet. For the price you won't find anything better or even close.
customer_reviews.author: Alz9

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Tablet
customer_reviews.text: I got a factory refurbished tablet and it looks and works like new. The tablet does everything I expect it to and is responsive and a pleasure to use. Battery life is very good. I strongly suggest getting a case to fit the tablet as it is quite thin and easy to lose your grip on. Great tablet - love it!!!! Seller delivered quickly and tablet was precisely as described.
customer_reviews.author: Cal Blue

customer_reviews.title: Very Pleased!
customer_reviews.text: This tablet has great sound, great screen responsiveness, and packs great memory and graphics abilities. It also has Androids latest Jelly Bean software version and an intel chip. Unless you want it encased in gold, there is plenty to like. Its easy to use if your an Apple person and offers a memory card slot to expand your data storage with ease. I bought the original ASUS keyboard case for it and it feels just right. Just get a matte screen protector to reduce glare and fingerprints on the screen thats the only thing that bothered me. ASUS got it right on this one! Its a winner!
customer_reviews.author: Guillermo Herrera

customer_reviews.title: ... this for my first tablet and it was the greatest! The highlight was it's benefit to cost ratio
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my first tablet and it was the greatest! The highlight was it's benefit to cost ratio. I used this tablet for EVERY thing. Games, lectures, research, social networks, and entertaining my nephew. The biggest highlight was it's microsd slot. I bought 2 16GB SDs and put all my movies on one, and all my music on the other, and made a little slot on my case to store them, making the 16Gb tab version just as good as the 32GB. After tampering with the Android software though I think I did something and it began to have regular crashes. Resetting it to factory condition fixed the issue and I sold it for a Nexus 9.
customer_reviews.author: Julian Lee

customer_reviews.title: Great tablet. Have had it for 5 years now ...
customer_reviews.text: Great tablet. Have had it for 5 years now and it still performs like new, No issues with the battery draining to fast or anything. Worth the buy.
customer_reviews.author: jdfet

customer_reviews.title: The new one is even faster than the old one and the screen is gorgeous and the battery life is better. Our son has a transformer
customer_reviews.text: This is our second one. The other one met an untimely death in a shopping cart. The edge of the digitizer got stuck under the back cart flap and it is done. The new one is even faster than the old one and the screen is gorgeous and the battery life is better. Our son has a transformer prime (201) earlier model and this is much better. Keep us the good work ASUS.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely LOVE it
customer_reviews.text: I have ZERO problems with this tablet. It's easy to use - comfortable to use. I LOVE it. So much so that we just bought my husband a brand new one of another brand (was on a good sale or I would have gotten him one of these) and he offered to let me have my choice - this one - which is a month or two old - or the brand new one - and I kept mine!! Can't say enough good things about it!!
customer_reviews.author: ML Betz

customer_reviews.title: Senior Citizen
customer_reviews.text: I'm somewhat challenged w/technology......but love love love this tablet. I'm still learning all the "bells and whistles" but was able to begin usage and navigation on my own, with no coach at hand. Working time on battery is close to 10hr....a big plus. Light weight and quite comfortable for the 10" size. Recommendation is: "Stellar Product".....
customer_reviews.author: Rita M. Baird

customer_reviews.title: Bought by mistake. Kept, it turned out the best.
customer_reviews.text: Buying Christmas presents, this product was accidently ordered with three others for a movie group being established. We kept this one as it was the best performer with the perfect specs for us and a great viewing experience. No lags. Quick. We are keeping this one. The others, we'll goodbye. Looking forward to being able ASUS client, in our movie group.
customer_reviews.author: Cate

customer_reviews.title: Mediocre at best
customer_reviews.text: Pros: It's priced decently. Um uh. . . yeah that's pretty much it. Cons: Still running Jelly Bean with no update in sight, so 2013, C'mon! Sluggish and buggy, apps quit often, maybe due to Intel architecture Heavy: hand and wrist start to hurt with prolonged use USB charging port on my unit was bad out of the box, didn't want to ship back, charging is tricky Basically serviceable tablet. I'm sure there are better options. Don't buy if you're prone to carpal tunnel. The damn thing weighs a ton for a tablet.
customer_reviews.author: Stauffenburg

customer_reviews.title: Tablet is good but it gives a lot of problems.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this tablet and it work fine. after 3 days the tablet started to give me problems. the tablet would suddenly turn off for no reason and sometimes the screen would go snowy. I check up this problem and i saw that a lot of people and companies that bought this product have the same problem. i wish that asus will fix this problem soon or i will exchange this tablet.
customer_reviews.author: Aryeh

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic device. I am new to tablets and still ...
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic device. I am new to tablets and still learning what to use it for(I bought this to force myself to learn new stuff) but the Asus is fast, the screen resolution is fantastic (it is weird watching a movie on a 10" screen!), and the sound is ok. I am sure I will figure out some apps that I can't live without and really see some benefit.
customer_reviews.author: GAMtnGuy

customer_reviews.title: We like this one
customer_reviews.text: We like this one. The screen resolution and other Android features were top of the line. I actually had to do a bit-of-hacking, because we use it for Chinese-Pinyin. This tablet had an Unchangeable System-Font (Asus allows you to change the size, but not the type). Some apps use the System-Font for foreign accent letters, and it was displaying them incorrectly. So I had to downgrade based on this issue. I did solve the issue.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Koernke

customer_reviews.title: Great tablet!
customer_reviews.text: I was debating whether to get an iPad or an Android tablet. Other reviews led me to this tablet. The price difference is substantial so I went with this tablet and I'm glad I did. My wife has a 4th gen iPad and there's nothing about that tablet that is better than my ASUS MeMO Pad FHD. I love it, love it, love it.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin M.

customer_reviews.title: I figured she didnt need a super fast tablet or anything since all she does is ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for my wife. I figured she didnt need a super fast tablet or anything since all she does is facebook and pay some bills and the occasional video call with her family. This thing works great. A lot faster than I expected since it is only dual core. The extra memory this thing has makes running apps a lot smoother than other competing devices. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Very Happy
customer_reviews.text: I've been using the Asus Memo Pad since February, and it works great; no problems. I found an offline map app, and now use it for my navigator. Looks like it will replace my laptop for most purposes. Adobe also makes some photo apps, and I will be using them soon as well. Super price, too. Recommend it if you're not ready to spring for a top-end Galaxy or iPad (or even if you are).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A gift for my wife
customer_reviews.text: And she loves it! It works well, looks good, holds a charge, does everything she needs. Nice electronics, I honestly don't think the over-priced Apple I-Pads have anything on this machine. (I have them at work and use them all the time.) May have to get one for myself.
customer_reviews.author: I_M_Pete

customer_reviews.title: ASUS User
customer_reviews.text: I purchase this ASUS MeMO Pad FHD 10'. because I want to learn how to use Android, and it has been a challenge from the start. It has some function like Windows7 and 8. It works fast, and it is hard to see the screen when you are outside. I also purchase a notepad with key board works with the Bluetooth, I'm use to the keyboard. It is just great no problems at all.
customer_reviews.author: andres

customer_reviews.title: Good tablet for a good price
customer_reviews.text: Of course this is not as fast and slick as it could be, but for a light user such as myself, this is perfect. I mainly wanted it to read recipes in the kitchen, watch netflix in the tub, and to travel with. So far it is doing a pretty good job. I have only had one glitch where it would not unlock the screen, but plugging it into the charger seemed to reset it and I was good to go.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Definitely worth the $$
customer_reviews.text: I had the TF101 for almost 2 years and decided to buy the MeMO Pad. Best decision ever. The video, speed and battery life are awesome! There were quite a few posts about the video however I think it rivals the best. iPad & Samsung look out, this one might unseat you. :)
customer_reviews.author: Kingmichaelg

customer_reviews.title: ASUS MeMO Pad FHD 10 ME302C-A1-BL 10.1-Inch 16GB Tablet (Blue)
customer_reviews.text: Great Buy! Look at the reviews for various tablet brands. If you like to shop around like me, you will find this brand (Asus) has great reviews from all tech guys and price-wise it is very economical when you get down to the nitty-gritty of the specs when comparing with other models and brands for 10-inch tablets. Works perfect no issues. Check out the Birugear Black SlimBook Leather Folio Stand Case Cover w/ Free screen protector And you will be all set to go!!! Trusted brand and arrives fast, You can't go wrong with this one! ;-)
customer_reviews.author: PickAFlower

customer_reviews.title: Flash Payer Working!
customer_reviews.text: I like it a lot now that I was able to load Flash Player on it in order to stream movies from a website called (superchillin.com A.K.A Noobroom). Just an FYI, I had to use a browser called Puffin, then go to the site and click on play then the sites version of Flash Player came up and I payed $0.99 annually to use it. After the short download it worked perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: MICHAEL

customer_reviews.title: Best 10" tablet for the money!
customer_reviews.text: It's been nearly a year, and has been a great tablet. Fairly fast, though bogs down if the internal storage gets near capacity. Beautiful, sharp screen, rivals my iPad 3 in sharpness and color. Lightweight, decent camera and the micro SD slot is a godsend. Only gripe is the excess Asus bloatware, there's a lot!
customer_reviews.author: Paul Tobeck

customer_reviews.title: Product Good
customer_reviews.text: Really like the product but the service was terrible!!! Site stated no S/H which they charged, but after complaining they did credit it back. However, was advertised as next day service - was received three (3) days later!! Lesson learned - don't believe everything you read on the site!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: GET IT, IT'S GREAT.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tablet. I have had several in the past few years and they are absolutely the greatest I will always own an ASUS.
customer_reviews.author: azon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I like it
customer_reviews.text: Seems to work great, not super fast but didn't' expect it to be. Firefox and adobe installed fine. Maybe they fixed the issue's others have made comments about. But Firefox is slower than Chrome on the tablet. I like it better than my Ipad2 which this replaced. Seems stable so far. 4 stars because there's always room for improvement.
customer_reviews.author: DualSportRider

customer_reviews.title: Asus MeMO Pad
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love my new Asus pad. It does great for the things that I wanted it for. Like watching Netflix, playing games and just surfing the web. It also came at a great time too. After just having shoulder surgery it was much easier to handle than my laptop and I could still do every thing that I wanted to do.
customer_reviews.author: S. Porter

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: I love this tablet because it's just what I was looking for. It's fast and has an amazing screen. High dollar tablet for a low price and the only reason I gave four stars instead of five because it needs silver light . I can't watch amazon videos form my prime membership. If you know a way around it then this tablet gets five stars.
customer_reviews.author: James Porter

customer_reviews.title: works great.
customer_reviews.text: It is working great so far, my one beef is I lost my email widget with no way to get it back as far as I can tell. Documentation and info seems to be very limited on this product, but the picture and functionality is excellent so far. I can easily recommend this at the price I bought it for, 3 or 4 hundred less than an iPad.
customer_reviews.author: Roy

customer_reviews.title: The sound is not so great when watching movies
customer_reviews.text: At first the wireless seemed to be very slow, after about a week however the speed went back to normal. The sound is not so great when watching movies, but still good enough for watching youtube clips. Serve my purpose of browsing the Internet and online reading, minor moive watch. I use it almost daily. Satisfied for the price i paid.
customer_reviews.author: Christine Yu

customer_reviews.title: Bad customer support.
customer_reviews.text: I love the tablet, but have been attempting to get a new charger for this tablet for 2 days. Their Customer Service is TERRIBLE. I have had 2 live chats, and was told both days that their system was down and they couldn't make a RMA, it's a charger they should just send one, not have me return the broken one. I also spoke with a person and was told that the system would be up in 24 hours, the live chat said 2 hours. It is a shame because the product is great, but the support is not worth the hassle. Most places would just send a charger and make the customer happy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best low-cost performer in the 10-inch tablet line
customer_reviews.text: Great deal for the price -- fast processor, solid display. My only complaint is that the stock OS doesn't allow superuser (the whole su , chown, and so on branch is missing, and simple root tools don't help). Otherwise, movies, games, websurfing, and the cool "forward // no, reverse" camera controls are just great.
customer_reviews.author: Carl Witthoft

customer_reviews.title: cool tablet, good value and great desing
customer_reviews.text: This tablet is solid, I bought this for my mom, is her first time using this sort of devices so no experience what so ever, and about 30 minutes she got it up and running, she is very glad specially with the battery life, I'm thinking on buying one or two more for my wife and kids, you can not go wrong with this tablet is big clear on sunny day light (we know about sun a little since we live in Aruba) and the speakers are nice and loud really recommend this as your alternative to ipad or galaxy tablets
customer_reviews.author: Rafael A. P. Maduro

customer_reviews.title: It will never update from Jelly Bean
customer_reviews.text: Please be warned that this tablet is operating on Jelly Bean, and Asus refuses to update it any further. So, if it's important to you that your tablet have the most current Android operating system, then don't get this tablet. Other than that, it's an OK tablet.
customer_reviews.author: K. Robertson

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Tablet
customer_reviews.text: I love this product. I have been shopping around for a lot of tablets before settling for this one. Its thin and sleek and looks very close to an IPAD for a much lesser price,. It also, has a long battery life and is very easy to set up. Took me just a fe minutes after unpacking to get going.
customer_reviews.author: Ajay

product_meta.title: ASUS MeMO Pad FHD 10 ME302C-A1-BL 10.1-Inch 16GB Tablet (Blue)
product_meta.description:
Size:16 GB| Color:BlueMeMO Pad FHD 10 (Blue); ME302C-A1-BL; Blue; Touch Screen; 10.1" WUXGA (19201200), 300 nits; INTEL Clover Trail Plus Z2560 (1.6GHz) Dual Core ; INTEL Clover Trail Plus Z2560; 2GB DDR2; SGX544MP2 ; 16GB Flash; No Optical Drive; Android Jellybean 4.2; 802.11ABGN; 1.2MP Front & 5MP Rear; Bluetooth 3.0; No keyboard (tablet); 1x Head phone / Mic-in; 1x Micro USB; 1x Micro HDMI; Micro SD (SDHC); 1 Year North America Warranty

AMAZON.COM
feature_bullets: 16 GB Flash Memory, 2 GB RAM Memory

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.9 out of 5 stars1,006 ratings3.9 out of 5 stars
